intro: Psephellus hymenolepis, commonly known as the hairy psephellus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
